questions.question: It was my manager …………………… sent the parcel to James yesterday.
questions.description: In structures like these we can use the relative pronoun who or that to refer to a personal subject.

questions.question: It was the parcel …………………………. my brother sent to James yesterday.
questions.description: Who cannot be used to refer to an object.

questions.question: It is he …………………………. responsible.
questions.description: In a formal style we use subject pronoun + who + verb in this structure.

questions.question: It is me ………………………… responsible.
questions.description: In an informal style we use ‘that + primary auxiliary’.

questions.question: It is you ………………………. in the wrong.
questions.description: In an informal style ‘that is’ is also possible here.

questions.question: ……………………. I did was to touch the vase, and it broke.
The reason ………………………… I went to London was to see my cousin.
questions.description: Reason can be followed by why or that.

questions.question: We moved to the countryside so that the children would have a garden …………………….
questions.description: In a less formal style we can use the infinitive + preposition instead of a relative pronoun.

questions.question: She was miserable unless she had people ……………………………….
questions.description: In a less formal style we can use the infinitive + preposition instead of a relative pronoun.

questions.question: Who is that girl …………………………. next to Peter?
